There are several things one can do to prolong the life of laptop batteries:

1. Adjust power settings: Use the Power Saver plan in your Windows or macOS laptop, which automatically adjusts display brightness and other hardware components to save energy.

2. Lower screen brightness: The backlight behind a laptop's display consumes considerable battery power. Reduce screen brightness as much as comfortable when working on the device.

3. Unplug peripherals when not in use: USB devices draw power from your laptop even if they aren't being actively used. Disconnect external hard drives, mice, and other peripherals when you don't need them.

4. Close unnecessary applications: Running multiple applications simultaneously puts extra load on the processor, consuming more battery life; close any unneeded apps running in the background.

5. Disable Wi-Fi and Bluetooth if not needed: If you're not using these two features, disable them to achieve longer run-time between recharges.

6. Activate Airplane Mode during offline work sessions â€“ This disables all wireless communications (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) saving significant amounts of power for increased battery life.

7.Use hibernation mode instead of sleep mode - Hibernation saves an image of your current settings onto disk space and completely powers down while conserving energy better than normal Sleep mode does

8.Regularly update software -Manufacturers often release updates that streamline code making it consume less resources helping improve overall performance.Use windows default updater or Mac app store to stay up-to-date with OS maintenance patches 

9.Maintain optimum temperature:Batteries discharge poorly at overly cold/hot temperatures.Store  laptops away from direct sunlight & vents and around room temperature

10.Perform regular virus scans-Keeping a healthy system free from hidden viruses ensures efficient processing ability without over-usage
